intro: Clidemia pittieri, commonly known as the Hawaiian stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia pittieri plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
